location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Copy of letter No 1/1 of 1873 from Colonel Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, on special duty with the Zanzibar and Muscat Mission, at Aden, to Brigadier General John William Schneider, Political Resident Aden

mods.abstract: Letter enclosing an extract from Letter No. 6704 of 18 November 1872 and requesting that Lieutenant Edward Mockler be instructed to proceed to Gwadur [Gwadar] and take charge of Captain Samuel Barrett Miles' office there, reporting to both the Commissioner in Sind and the Political Agent at Muscat.Enclosed with the letter is an extract of letter No. 6704, 18 November 1872, from the Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay to Colonel Lewis Pelly, informing him that Captain Mills will be taking charge of duties at Muscat and that should Pelly feel that an Officer will be required to act at Gwadur to apply to the Resident at Aden for the services of Lieutenant Mockler.
